Package de.db.derpate.util

Class StringEscapeUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.db.derpate.util.StringEscapeUtil
  • public final class StringEscapeUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This util escapes and unescapes Strings for HTML and JSON.
    It uses the StringEscapeUtils.
    Author:
    MichelBlank

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static @Nullable java.lang.String decodeURL​(@Nullable java.lang.String url)
      Unescapes characters for further use (e.g.
      static @Nullable java.lang.String encodeURL​(@Nullable java.lang.String url)
      Escapes characters for use in a URL
      static @Nullable java.lang.String escapeHtml​(@Nullable java.lang.String string)
      Escapes the characters in a String using HTML entities.
      For example:
      "max" & "mustermann"
      becomes:
      &quot;max&quot; &amp; &quot;mustermann&quot;
      static @Nullable java.lang.String escapeJson​(@Nullable java.lang.String string)
      Escapes the characters in a String using Json String rules.
      Escapes any values it finds into their Json String form.
      static @Nullable java.lang.String unescapeHtml​(@Nullable java.lang.String html)
      Unescapes a String containing entity escapes to a string containing the actual Unicode characters corresponding to the escapes.
      For example:
      &quot;max&quot; &amp; &quot;mustermann&quot;
      becomes:
      "max" & "mustermann"
      If an entity is unrecognized, it is left alone, and inserted verbatim into the result string.
      static @Nullable java.lang.String unescapeJson​(@Nullable java.lang.String json)
      Unescapes any Json literals found in the String.

    • Method Detail

      • escapeHtml

        public static @Nullable java.lang.String escapeHtml​(@Nullable java.lang.String string)
        Escapes the characters in a String using HTML entities.
        For example:
        "max" & "mustermann"
        becomes:
        &quot;max&quot; &amp; &quot;mustermann&quot;
        Parameters:
        string - the String to escape
        Returns:
        the escaped String or null, if string was null beforehand
        See Also:
        StringEscapeUtils.escapeHtml4(String)

      • unescapeHtml

        public static @Nullable java.lang.String unescapeHtml​(@Nullable java.lang.String html)
        Unescapes a String containing entity escapes to a string containing the actual Unicode characters corresponding to the escapes.
        For example:
        &quot;max&quot; &amp; &quot;mustermann&quot;
        becomes:
        "max" & "mustermann"
        If an entity is unrecognized, it is left alone, and inserted verbatim into the result string.
        Parameters:
        html - the escaped String
        Returns:
        unescaped html
        See Also:
        StringEscapeUtils.unescapeHtml4(String)

      • escapeJson

        public static @Nullable java.lang.String escapeJson​(@Nullable java.lang.String string)
        Escapes the characters in a String using Json String rules.
        Escapes any values it finds into their Json String form. Deals correctly with quotes and control-chars (tab, backslash, character return, etc.).
        For example:
        He didn't say "Hello!"
        becomes:
        He didn't say \"Hello!\"
        Parameters:
        string - String to escape values in
        Returns:
        String with escaped values or null, if string was null beforehand
        See Also:
        StringEscapeUtils.escapeJson(String)

      • unescapeJson

        public static @Nullable java.lang.String unescapeJson​(@Nullable java.lang.String json)
        Unescapes any Json literals found in the String. For example, it will turn a sequence of '\' and 'n' into a newline character, unless the '\' is preceded by another '\'.
        Parameters:
        json - the String to unescape
        Returns:
        unescaped String or null, if string was null beforehand
        See Also:
        StringEscapeUtils.unescapeJson(String)

      • encodeURL

        public static @Nullable java.lang.String encodeURL​(@Nullable java.lang.String url)
        Escapes characters for use in a URL
        Parameters:
        url - the string
        Returns:
        the translated string or null, if url was null or charset "UTF-8" was not found

      • decodeURL

        public static @Nullable java.lang.String decodeURL​(@Nullable java.lang.String url)
        Unescapes characters for further use (e.g. "+" -> blank space)
        Parameters:
        url - the url
        Returns:
        the translated string or null, if url was null or charset "UTF-8" was not found
